page.title: 08MAN AND HIS SURROUNDINGS
page.content: This is a rural area and has been drained by ditches called{rhynes.}The land being marshy,attracts birds like {Herons and Kingfishers,}as well as the usual species one would expect to find in the West of England.Local groups are concerned to maintain much of the land uncultivated to retain the natural habitat for the marsh loving plants birds and animals. There is also opposition to the process of drainage which is gradually rendering the ground fit for pasture and in many cases the cultivation of crops. {Elm trees}were very common here but have been decimated by{Dutch Elm disease. A great deal of litter finds its way on to the pathways and is a sad reflection on some peoples lack of care for the countryside.
